diversionary adjective
(TAKING ATTENTION AWAY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
taking your attention away from something else: The proposal was dismissed as a diversionary tactic intended to distract attention from the real problems. Military personnel would be distracted with diversionary moves so others could break into the base.

diversionary adjective
(TREATMENT)
dealing with someone, for example someone who has committed a crime, by giving them special treatment, rather than by sending them to prison, etc.: The money went to the district attorney's office to pay for a diversionary scheme designed to reduce the prison population. There are a number of well-resourced diversionary schemes for young offenders.
